content.description: Climbs up the center of Your Wall. Start below and to the right of the high undercling and climb up to the right of the waffle iron-of-varnish feature. The anchors are protected by some thin moves at the top.
content.location: Centered on the wall. Start has obvious chalked undercling about 10' up.

content.description: Leftmost route on the wall and an alternate start to Footless. Climb the inside corner created by the missing section of rock. Pull out and around the overhang and finish up Footless at the fourth bolt.

On the right side of the wall there is a lower angle ramp that separates the main wall from a steep, overhanging bulge. Climb the left side of the ramp following the discontinuous crack in the corner up to the anchors. Can be done on gear but then you’re not mollycoddled, are you?
content.protection: 7 bolts to quick-clips at the top
content.location: Rightmost route on the wall. Climbs the lower angle ramp/corner.

content.description: Start at the right side of the main wall, to the left of the corner/ramp. Climb up thin, crimpy moves to reach the huecos and easier climbing on the upper half. The crux comes in through the second and third bolts. It’s possible to mollycoddle yourself and traverse into the climb around from the right avoiding some of the hard crimps.
content.location: Right side of the wall, to the left of the corner/ramp. Shares the starting side-pull pockets with Waffle Iron to the left.

content.description: On the left side of the wall there is a roof and left-facing corner formed by what appears as a large missing section of the wall. A lack of good foot holds off the deck make for a burly start on the outside corner formed by the missing section of the wall. Climb up the short arete and trend slightly right, but staying left of most of the hueco features that make up the route, Fisted Hueco, to the right.6 bolts to quick-clip anchors set kinda high up as the top slabs over.
content.location: Starts on the arete formed by the missing section of rock on the left side of the face.

content.description: Climbs the center left of the main face of Your Wall. A hard start and pumpy first half leads to a choice of huecos and good rests. Climbs hard until you work out the beta, then it flows nicely.
content.location: Second route from the arete/corner on the left side of the wall.

content.description: Your Wall is a compact, secluded cliff with nice views of Ash Meadows and the Las Vegas valley. It is a vertical, varnished face identified by a large cutout of rock on its lower left side which forms a left-facing corner and a roof. The right side of the wall forms a left-facing corner with a lower angle ramp and overhanging bulge. It's located above and climber’s left of the Fringe. It's also across the wash from the Overlook. The wall is SE facing and visible from the Kraft parking lot. It gets lots of morning sun, and goes into the shade after noon in the winter, and after 2pm in the summer. All routes are bolt protected sport climbs. The approach is kinda long for a Red Rock sport climbing wall, but you won't deal with crowds at all, and there are other walls in the area to round out a full day.
